articles.title: Solar storm: UK alert as Earth faces 'glancing blows' – sun erupts with 'dozens' of flares - Express
articles.description: THE EARTH continues to be pummeling by solar storms as space experts warn that we could face dozens more impacts over the next few days - and aurora could be visible in the UK.

articles.title: Battery power problem cuts short Russian spacewalk, Nasa says - BBC
articles.description: A cosmonaut was rushed back to the International Space Station on Wednesday, the US space agency says.
articles.content:

articles.title: NASA finds a new MOON orbiting an asteroid 480 million miles from Earth - Daily Mail
articles.description: The newly-found, three-mile-wide natural satellite orbits the 17-mile-wide asteroid Polymele, which is about 480 million miles from Earth.

NASA astronomers have discovered a new moon orbiting an asteroid 480 million miles from Earth.

articles.author: Fiona Jackson
articles.title: Astrophotographer captures clear image of Saturn as it makes its closest approach to Earth this year - Daily Mail
articles.description: An astrophotographer captured his clearest ever photo of Saturn from Los Angeles, USA on Sunday. The gas giant also reached its closest point to Earth this year, and was therefore at its brightest.
articles.content:
An astrophotographer has taken his clearest ever picture of Saturn while it made its closest approach to Earth this year.
